intro: Carex flacca var. oogyna, commonly known as the slender sedge, is a perennial plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny flowers. It typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
